functions.name: absDomainName
functions.desc: absDomainName returns an absolute domain name which ends with a trailing dot to match pure Go reverse resolver and all other lookup routines. See golang.org/issue/12189. But we don't want to add dots for local names from /etc/hosts. It's hard to tell so we settle on the heuristic that names without dots (like "localhost" or "myhost") do not get trailing dots, but any other names do.

functions.name: adapterAddresses
functions.desc: adapterAddresses returns a list of IP adapter and address structures. The structure contains an IP adapter and flattened multiple IP addresses including unicast, anycast and multicast addresses.

functions.name: avoidDNS
functions.desc: avoidDNS reports whether this is a hostname for which we should not use DNS. Currently this includes only .onion, per RFC 7686. See golang.org/issue/13705. Does not cover .local names (RFC 6762), see golang.org/issue/16739.

functions.name: boolint
functions.desc: Boolean to int.

functions.name: canUseConnectEx
functions.desc: canUseConnectEx reports whether we can use the ConnectEx Windows API call for the given network type.

functions.name: checkGetmac
functions.desc: check that getmac exists as a powershell command, and that it speaks English.

functions.name: checkHeader
functions.desc: checkHeader performs basic sanity checks on the header.

functions.name: commonPrefixLen
functions.desc: commonPrefixLen reports the length of the longest prefix (looking at the most significant, or leftmost, bits) that the two addresses have in common, up to the length of a's prefix (i.e., the portion of the address not including the interface ID).  If a or b is an IPv4 address as an IPv6 address, the IPv4 addresses are compared (with max common prefix length of 32). If a and b are different IP versions, 0 is returned.  See https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6724#section-2.2

functions.name: compareByRFC6724
functions.desc: compareByRFC6724 compares two byRFC6724Info records and returns an integer indicating the order. It follows the algorithm and variable names from RFC 6724 section 6. Returns -1 if a is preferred, 1 if b is preferred, and 0 if they are equal.

functions.name: concurrentThreadsLimit
functions.desc: concurrentThreadsLimit returns the number of threads we permit to run concurrently doing DNS lookups.

functions.name: countAnyByte
functions.desc: Count occurrences in s of any bytes in t.

functions.name: doBlockingWithCtx
functions.desc: doBlockingWithCtx executes a blocking function in a separate goroutine when the provided context is cancellable. It is intended for use with calls that don't support context cancellation (cgo, syscalls). blocking func may still be running after this function finishes. For the duration of the execution of the blocking function, the thread is 'acquired' using [acquireThread], blocking might not be executed when the context gets canceled early.

functions.name: dtoi
functions.desc: Decimal to integer. Returns number, characters consumed, success.

functions.name: expectSendfile
functions.desc: expectSendfile runs f, and verifies that internal/poll.SendFile successfully handles a write to wantConn during f's execution.  On platforms where supportsSendfile() is false, expectSendfile runs f but does not expect a call to SendFile.

functions.name: extractExtendedRCode
functions.desc: extractExtendedRCode extracts the extended RCode from the OPT resource (EDNS(0)) If an OPT record is not found, the RCode from the hdr is returned. Another return value indicates whether an additional resource was found.

functions.name: favoriteAddrFamily
functions.desc: favoriteAddrFamily returns the appropriate address family for the given network, laddr, raddr and mode.  If mode indicates "listen" and laddr is a wildcard, we assume that the user wants to make a passive-open connection with a wildcard address family, both AF_INET and AF_INET6, and a wildcard address like the following:    - A listen for a wildcard communication domain, "tcp" or     "udp", with a wildcard address: If the platform supports     both IPv6 and IPv4-mapped IPv6 communication capabilities,     or does not support IPv4, we use a dual stack, AF_INET6 and     IPV6_V6ONLY=0, wildcard address listen. The dual stack     wildcard address listen may fall back to an IPv6-only,     AF_INET6 and IPV6_V6ONLY=1, wildcard address listen.     Otherwise we prefer an IPv4-only, AF_INET, wildcard address     listen.    - A listen for a wildcard communication domain, "tcp" or     "udp", with an IPv4 wildcard address: same as above.    - A listen for a wildcard communication domain, "tcp" or     "udp", with an IPv6 wildcard address: same as above.    - A listen for an IPv4 communication domain, "tcp4" or "udp4",     with an IPv4 wildcard address: We use an IPv4-only, AF_INET,     wildcard address listen.    - A listen for an IPv6 communication domain, "tcp6" or "udp6",     with an IPv6 wildcard address: We use an IPv6-only, AF_INET6     and IPV6_V6ONLY=1, wildcard address listen.  Otherwise guess: If the addresses are IPv4 then returns AF_INET, or else returns AF_INET6. It also returns a boolean value what designates IPV6_V6ONLY option.  Note that the latest DragonFly BSD and OpenBSD kernels allow neither "net.inet6.ip6.v6only=1" change nor IPPROTO_IPV6 level IPV6_V6ONLY socket option setting.  favoriteAddrFamily should be an internal detail, but widely used packages access it using linkname. Notable members of the hall of shame include:   - github.com/database64128/tfo-go/v2   - github.com/metacubex/tfo-go   - github.com/sagernet/tfo-go  Do not remove or change the type signature. See go.dev/issue/67401.

functions.name: fd_fdstat_get_type
functions.desc: This helper is implemented in the syscall package. It means we don't have to redefine the fd_fdstat_get host import or the fdstat struct it populates.

functions.name: filterAddrList
functions.desc: filterAddrList applies a filter to a list of IP addresses, yielding a list of Addr objects. Known filters are nil, ipv4only, and ipv6only. It returns every address when the filter is nil. The result contains at least one address when error is nil.

functions.name: forceCgoDNS
functions.desc: forceCgoDNS forces the resolver configuration to use the cgo resolver and returns a fixup function to restore the old settings.

functions.name: forceCloseSockets
functions.desc: forceCloseSockets must be called only from TestMain.

functions.name: forceGoDNS
functions.desc: forceGoDNS forces the resolver configuration to use the pure Go resolver and returns a fixup function to restore the old settings.

functions.name: foreachField
functions.desc: foreachField runs fn on each non-empty run of non-space bytes in x. It returns the first non-nil error returned by fn.

functions.name: genericReadFrom
functions.desc: Fallback implementation of io.ReaderFrom's ReadFrom, when sendfile isn't applicable.

functions.name: genericWriteTo
functions.desc: Fallback implementation of io.WriterTo's WriteTo, when zero-copy isn't applicable.

functions.name: goDebugNetDNS
functions.desc: goDebugNetDNS parses the value of the GODEBUG "netdns" value. The netdns value can be of the form:  	1       // debug level 1 	2       // debug level 2 	cgo     // use cgo for DNS lookups 	go      // use go for DNS lookups 	cgo+1   // use cgo for DNS lookups + debug level 1 	1+cgo   // same 	cgo+2   // same, but debug level 2  etc.

functions.name: goLookupIPFiles
functions.desc: lookup entries from /etc/hosts

functions.name: goLookupPort
functions.desc: goLookupPort is the native Go implementation of LookupPort.

functions.name: goosPrefersCgo
functions.desc: goosPrefersCgo reports whether the GOOS value passed in prefers the cgo resolver.

functions.name: hasFallenBack
functions.desc: hasFallenBack reports whether the MPTCP connection has fallen back to "plain" TCP.  A connection can fallback to TCP for different reasons, e.g. the other peer doesn't support it, a middle box "accidentally" drops the option, etc.  If the MPTCP protocol has not been requested when creating the socket, this method will return true: MPTCP is not being used.  Kernel >= 5.16 returns EOPNOTSUPP/ENOPROTOOPT in case of fallback. Older kernels will always return them even if MPTCP is used: not usable.

functions.name: hasUpperCase
functions.desc: hasUpperCase tells whether the given string contains at least one upper-case.

functions.name: initConfVal
functions.desc: initConfVal initializes confVal based on the environment that will not change during program execution.

functions.name: initMPTCPavailable
functions.desc: Check that MPTCP is supported by attempting to create an MPTCP socket and by looking at the returned error if any.

functions.name: interfaceAddrTable
functions.desc: If the ifi is nil, interfaceAddrTable returns addresses for all network interfaces. Otherwise it returns addresses for a specific interface.

functions.name: interfaceMulticastAddrTable
functions.desc: interfaceMulticastAddrTable returns addresses for a specific interface.

functions.name: interfaceTable
functions.desc: If the ifindex is zero, interfaceTable returns mappings of all network interfaces. Otherwise it returns a mapping of a specific interface.

functions.name: ipAddrsEface
functions.desc: ipAddrsEface returns an empty interface slice of addrs.

functions.name: ipEmptyString
functions.desc: ipEmptyString is like ip.String except that it returns an empty string when ip is unset.

functions.name: ipToSockaddr
functions.desc: ipToSockaddr should be an internal detail, but widely used packages access it using linkname. Notable members of the hall of shame include:   - github.com/database64128/tfo-go/v2   - github.com/metacubex/tfo-go   - github.com/sagernet/tfo-go  Do not remove or change the type signature. See go.dev/issue/67401.

functions.name: ipVersion
functions.desc: ipVersion returns the provided network's IP version: '4', '6' or 0 if network does not end in a '4' or '6' byte.

functions.name: ipv4only
functions.desc: ipv4only reports whether addr is an IPv4 address.

functions.name: ipv6LinkLocalUnicastAddr
functions.desc: ipv6LinkLocalUnicastAddr returns an IPv6 link-local unicast address on the given network interface for tests. It returns "" if no suitable address is found.

functions.name: ipv6only
functions.desc: ipv6only reports whether addr is an IPv6 address except IPv4-mapped IPv6 address.

functions.name: isDeadlineExceeded
functions.desc: isDeadlineExceeded reports whether err is or wraps os.ErrDeadlineExceeded. We also check that the error implements net.Error, and that the Timeout method returns true.

functions.name: isDomainName
functions.desc: isDomainName checks if a string is a presentation-format domain name (currently restricted to hostname-compatible "preferred name" LDH labels and SRV-like "underscore labels"; see golang.org/issue/12421).  isDomainName should be an internal detail, but widely used packages access it using linkname. Notable members of the hall of shame include:   - github.com/sagernet/sing  Do not remove or change the type signature. See go.dev/issue/67401.

functions.name: isGateway
functions.desc: isGateway reports whether h should be considered a "gateway" name for the myhostname NSS module.

functions.name: isIPv4
functions.desc: isIPv4 reports whether addr contains an IPv4 address.

functions.name: isLocalhost
functions.desc: isLocalhost reports whether h should be considered a "localhost" name for the myhostname NSS module.

functions.name: isNotIPv4
functions.desc: isNotIPv4 reports whether addr does not contain an IPv4 address.

functions.name: isOutbound
functions.desc: isOutbound reports whether h should be considered an "outbound" name for the myhostname NSS module.

functions.name: isSpace
functions.desc: isSpace reports whether b is an ASCII space character.

functions.name: isUsingMPTCPProto
functions.desc: isUsingMPTCPProto reports whether the socket protocol is MPTCP.  Compared to hasFallenBack method, here only the socket protocol being used is checked: it can be MPTCP but it doesn't mean MPTCP is used on the wire, maybe a fallback to TCP has been done.

functions.name: isUsingMultipathTCP
functions.desc: isUsingMultipathTCP reports whether MPTCP is still being used.  Please look at the description of hasFallenBack (kernel >=5.16) and isUsingMPTCPProto methods for more details about what is being checked here.

functions.name: isZeros
functions.desc: Is p all zeros?

functions.name: listenerBacklog
functions.desc: listenerBacklog is a caching wrapper around maxListenerBacklog.  listenerBacklog should be an internal detail, but widely used packages access it using linkname. Notable members of the hall of shame include:   - github.com/database64128/tfo-go/v2   - github.com/metacubex/tfo-go   - github.com/sagernet/tfo-go  Do not remove or change the type signature. See go.dev/issue/67401.

functions.name: lookupIPReturn
functions.desc: lookupIPReturn turns the return values from singleflight.Do into the return values from LookupIP.

functions.name: lookupProtocol
functions.desc: lookupProtocol looks up IP protocol name and returns correspondent protocol number.

functions.name: lookupStaticAddr
functions.desc: lookupStaticAddr looks up the hosts for the given address from /etc/hosts.

functions.name: lookupStaticHost
functions.desc: lookupStaticHost looks up the addresses and the canonical name for the given host from /etc/hosts.

functions.name: lowerASCII
functions.desc: lowerASCII returns the ASCII lowercase version of b.

functions.name: lowerASCIIBytes
functions.desc: lowerASCIIBytes makes x ASCII lowercase in-place.

functions.name: mapErr
functions.desc: mapErr maps from the context errors to the historical internal net error values.

functions.name: maxAckBacklog
functions.desc: Linux stores the backlog as:    - uint16 in kernel version < 4.1,   - uint32 in kernel version >= 4.1  Truncate number to avoid wrapping.  See issue 5030 and 41470.

functions.name: mustHaveExternalNetwork
functions.desc: mustHaveExternalNetwork is like testenv.MustHaveExternalNetwork except on non-Linux, non-mobile builders it permits the test to run in -short mode.

functions.name: mustSetDeadline
functions.desc: mustSetDeadline calls the bound method m to set a deadline on a Conn. If the call fails, mustSetDeadline skips t if the current GOOS is believed not to support deadlines, or fails the test otherwise.

functions.name: newUnixFile
functions.desc: Defined in os package.

functions.name: newWindowsFile
functions.desc: Defined in os package.

functions.name: nextTimeout
functions.desc: nextTimeout returns the next timeout to try after an operation took the given actual duration with a timeout shorter than that duration.

functions.name: parseAcceptError
functions.desc: parseAcceptError parses nestedErr and reports whether it is a valid error value from Accept functions. It returns nil when nestedErr is valid.

functions.name: parseCloseError
functions.desc: parseCloseError parses nestedErr and reports whether it is a valid error value from Close functions. It returns nil when nestedErr is valid.

functions.name: parseCommonError
functions.desc: parseCommonError parses nestedErr and reports whether it is a valid error value from miscellaneous functions. It returns nil when nestedErr is valid.

functions.name: parseCriteria
functions.desc: parses "foo=bar !foo=bar"

functions.name: parseDialError
functions.desc: parseDialError parses nestedErr and reports whether it is a valid error value from Dial, Listen functions. It returns nil when nestedErr is valid.

functions.name: parsePlan9Addr
functions.desc: parsePlan9Addr parses address of the form [ip!]port (e.g. 127.0.0.1!80).

functions.name: parsePort
functions.desc: parsePort parses service as a decimal integer and returns the corresponding value as port. It is the caller's responsibility to parse service as a non-decimal integer when needsLookup is true.  Some system resolvers will return a valid port number when given a number over 65536 (see https://golang.org/issues/11715). Alas, the parser can't bail early on numbers > 65536. Therefore reasonably large/small numbers are parsed in full and rejected if invalid.

functions.name: parseReadError
functions.desc: parseReadError parses nestedErr and reports whether it is a valid error value from Read functions. It returns nil when nestedErr is valid.

functions.name: parseWriteError
functions.desc: parseWriteError parses nestedErr and reports whether it is a valid error value from Write functions. It returns nil when nestedErr is valid.

functions.name: partialDeadline
functions.desc: partialDeadline returns the deadline to use for a single address, when multiple addresses are pending.

functions.name: plan9LocalAddr
functions.desc: plan9LocalAddr returns a Plan 9 local address string. See setladdrport at https://9p.io/sources/plan9/sys/src/9/ip/devip.c.

functions.name: removeComment
functions.desc: removeComment returns line, removing any '#' byte and any following bytes.

functions.name: resSearch
functions.desc: resSearch will make a call to the 'res_nsearch' routine in the C library and parse the output as a slice of DNS resources.

functions.name: resolveCNAME
functions.desc: returns the last CNAME in chain.

functions.name: reverseaddr
functions.desc: reverseaddr returns the in-addr.arpa. or ip6.arpa. hostname of the IP address addr suitable for rDNS (PTR) record lookup or an error if it fails to parse the IP address.

functions.name: roundDurationUp
functions.desc: roundDurationUp rounds d to the next multiple of to.

functions.name: runningGoroutines
functions.desc: runningGoroutines returns a list of remaining goroutines.

functions.name: runtime_rand
functions.desc: provided by runtime

functions.name: sendFile
functions.desc: sendFile copies the contents of r to c using the sendfile system call to minimize copies.  if handled == true, sendFile returns the number (potentially zero) of bytes copied and any non-EOF error.  if handled == false, sendFile performed no work.

functions.name: setKeepAliveIdle
functions.desc: Set keep alive period.

functions.name: setKeepAliveIdleAndInterval
functions.desc: setKeepAliveIdleAndInterval serves for kernels prior to Windows 10, version 1709.

functions.name: setKeepAliveIdleAndIntervalAndCount
functions.desc: setKeepAliveIdleAndIntervalAndCount serves for Solaris prior to 11.4 by simulating the TCP_KEEPIDLE, TCP_KEEPINTVL, and TCP_KEEPCNT with `TCP_KEEPALIVE_THRESHOLD` + `TCP_KEEPALIVE_ABORT_THRESHOLD`.

functions.name: simpleMaskLength
functions.desc: If mask is a sequence of 1 bits followed by 0 bits, return the number of 1 bits.

functions.name: slowDialTCP
functions.desc: In some environments, the slow IPs may be explicitly unreachable, and fail more quickly than expected. This test hook prevents dialTCP from returning before the deadline.

functions.name: socket
functions.desc: socket returns a network file descriptor that is ready for I/O using the fake network.

functions.name: spliceFrom
functions.desc: spliceFrom transfers data from r to c using the splice system call to minimize copies from and to userspace. c must be a TCP connection. Currently, spliceFrom is only enabled if r is a TCP or a stream-oriented Unix connection.  If spliceFrom returns handled == false, it has performed no work.

functions.name: spliceTo
functions.desc: spliceTo transfers data from c to w using the splice system call to minimize copies from and to userspace. c must be a TCP connection. Currently, spliceTo is only enabled if w is a stream-oriented Unix connection.  If spliceTo returns handled == false, it has performed no work.

functions.name: splitAtBytes
functions.desc: Split s at any bytes in t.

functions.name: srcAddrs
functions.desc: srcAddrs tries to UDP-connect to each address to see if it has a route. (This doesn't send any packets). The destination port number is irrelevant.

functions.name: stringsEqualFold
functions.desc: stringsEqualFold is strings.EqualFold, ASCII only. It reports whether s and t are equal, ASCII-case-insensitively.

functions.name: stringsHasSuffixFold
functions.desc: stringsHasSuffixFold reports whether s ends in suffix, ASCII-case-insensitively.

functions.name: supportsIPv4
functions.desc: supportsIPv4 reports whether the platform supports IPv4 networking functionality.

functions.name: supportsIPv4map
functions.desc: supportsIPv4map reports whether the platform supports mapping an IPv4 address inside an IPv6 address at transport layer protocols. See RFC 4291, RFC 4038 and RFC 3493.

functions.name: supportsIPv6
functions.desc: supportsIPv6 reports whether the platform supports IPv6 networking functionality.

functions.name: supportsSendfile
functions.desc: Always true except for workstation and client versions of Windows

functions.name: sysSocket
functions.desc: Wrapper around the socket system call that marks the returned file descriptor as nonblocking and close-on-exec.

functions.name: testUnixAddr
functions.desc: testUnixAddr uses os.MkdirTemp to get a name that is unique.

functions.name: testableAddress
functions.desc: testableAddress reports whether address of network is testable on the current platform configuration.

functions.name: testableListenArgs
functions.desc: testableListenArgs reports whether arguments are testable on the current platform configuration.

functions.name: testableNetwork
functions.desc: testableNetwork reports whether network is testable on the current platform configuration.

functions.name: timeoutUpperBound
functions.desc: timeoutUpperBound returns the maximum time that we expect a timeout of duration d to take to return the caller.

functions.name: toLower
functions.desc: toLower returns a lower-case version of in. Restricting us to ASCII is sufficient to handle the IP protocol names and allow us to not depend on the strings and unicode packages.

functions.name: trimSpace
functions.desc: trimSpace returns x without any leading or trailing ASCII whitespace.

functions.name: validRecs
functions.desc: returns only results applicable to name and resolves CNAME entries.

functions.name: withTCPConnPair
functions.desc: withTCPConnPair sets up a TCP connection between two peers, then runs peer1 and peer2 concurrently. withTCPConnPair returns when both have completed.

functions.name: withUnexpiredValuesPreserved
functions.desc: withUnexpiredValuesPreserved returns a context.Context that only uses lookupCtx for its values, otherwise it is never canceled and has no deadline. If the lookup context expires, any looked up values will return nil. See Issue 28600.

functions.name: wrapSyscallError
functions.desc: wrapSyscallError takes an error and a syscall name. If the error is a syscall.Errno, it wraps it in an os.SyscallError using the syscall name.

functions.name: xtoi
functions.desc: Hexadecimal to integer. Returns number, characters consumed, success.

functions.name: xtoi2
functions.desc: xtoi2 converts the next two hex digits of s into a byte. If s is longer than 2 bytes then the third byte must be e. If the first two bytes of s are not hex digits or the third byte does not match e, false is returned.

functions.name: Read
functions.desc: Read from the buffers.  Read implements [io.Reader] for [Buffers].  Read modifies the slice v as well as v[i] for 0 <= i < len(v), but does not modify v[i][j] for any i, j.

functions.name: WriteTo
functions.desc: WriteTo writes contents of the buffers to w.  WriteTo implements [io.WriterTo] for [Buffers].  WriteTo modifies the slice v as well as v[i] for 0 <= i < len(v), but does not modify v[i][j] for any i, j.

functions.name: Temporary
functions.desc: Temporary reports whether the DNS error is known to be temporary. This is not always known; a DNS lookup may fail due to a temporary error and return a [DNSError] for which Temporary returns false.

functions.name: Timeout
functions.desc: Timeout reports whether the DNS lookup is known to have timed out. This is not always known; a DNS lookup may fail due to a timeout and return a [DNSError] for which Timeout returns false.

functions.name: Unwrap
functions.desc: Unwrap returns e.UnwrapErr.

functions.name: Dial
functions.desc: Dial connects to the address on the named network.  See func Dial for a description of the network and address parameters.  Dial uses [context.Background] internally; to specify the context, use [Dialer.DialContext].

functions.name: DialContext
functions.desc: DialContext connects to the address on the named network using the provided context.  The provided Context must be non-nil. If the context expires before the connection is complete, an error is returned. Once successfully connected, any expiration of the context will not affect the connection.  When using TCP, and the host in the address parameter resolves to multiple network addresses, any dial timeout (from d.Timeout or ctx) is spread over each consecutive dial, such that each is given an appropriate fraction of the time to connect. For example, if a host has 4 IP addresses and the timeout is 1 minute, the connect to each single address will be given 15 seconds to complete before trying the next one.  See func [Dial] for a description of the network and address parameters.

functions.name: MultipathTCP
functions.desc: MultipathTCP reports whether MPTCP will be used.  This method doesn't check if MPTCP is supported by the operating system or not.

functions.name: SetMultipathTCP
functions.desc: SetMultipathTCP directs the [Dial] methods to use, or not use, MPTCP, if supported by the operating system. This method overrides the system default and the GODEBUG=multipathtcp=... setting if any.  If MPTCP is not available on the host or not supported by the server, the Dial methods will fall back to TCP.

functions.name: deadline
functions.desc: deadline returns the earliest of:   - now+Timeout   - d.Deadline   - the context's deadline  Or zero, if none of Timeout, Deadline, or context's deadline is set.

functions.name: AppendText
functions.desc: AppendText implements the [encoding.TextAppender] interface. The encoding is the same as returned by [IP.String], with one exception: When len(ip) is zero, it appends nothing.

functions.name: DefaultMask
functions.desc: DefaultMask returns the default IP mask for the IP address ip. Only IPv4 addresses have default masks; DefaultMask returns nil if ip is not a valid IPv4 address.

functions.name: Equal
functions.desc: Equal reports whether ip and x are the same IP address. An IPv4 address and that same address in IPv6 form are considered to be equal.

functions.name: IsGlobalUnicast
functions.desc: IsGlobalUnicast reports whether ip is a global unicast address.  The identification of global unicast addresses uses address type identification as defined in RFC 1122, RFC 4632 and RFC 4291 with the exception of IPv4 directed broadcast addresses. It returns true even if ip is in IPv4 private address space or local IPv6 unicast address space.

functions.name: IsInterfaceLocalMulticast
functions.desc: IsInterfaceLocalMulticast reports whether ip is an interface-local multicast address.

functions.name: IsLinkLocalMulticast
functions.desc: IsLinkLocalMulticast reports whether ip is a link-local multicast address.

functions.name: IsLinkLocalUnicast
functions.desc: IsLinkLocalUnicast reports whether ip is a link-local unicast address.

functions.name: IsLoopback
functions.desc: IsLoopback reports whether ip is a loopback address.

functions.name: IsMulticast
functions.desc: IsMulticast reports whether ip is a multicast address.

functions.name: IsPrivate
functions.desc: IsPrivate reports whether ip is a private address, according to RFC 1918 (IPv4 addresses) and RFC 4193 (IPv6 addresses).

functions.name: IsUnspecified
functions.desc: IsUnspecified reports whether ip is an unspecified address, either the IPv4 address "0.0.0.0" or the IPv6 address "::".

functions.name: MarshalText
functions.desc: MarshalText implements the [encoding.TextMarshaler] interface. The encoding is the same as returned by [IP.String], with one exception: When len(ip) is zero, it returns an empty slice.

functions.name: Mask
functions.desc: Mask returns the result of masking the IP address ip with mask.

functions.name: String
functions.desc: String returns the string form of the IP address ip. It returns one of 4 forms:   - "<nil>", if ip has length 0   - dotted decimal ("192.0.2.1"), if ip is an IPv4 or IP4-mapped IPv6 address   - IPv6 conforming to RFC 5952 ("2001:db8::1"), if ip is a valid IPv6 address   - the hexadecimal form of ip, without punctuation, if no other cases apply

functions.name: To16
functions.desc: To16 converts the IP address ip to a 16-byte representation. If ip is not an IP address (it is the wrong length), To16 returns nil.

functions.name: To4
functions.desc: To4 converts the IPv4 address ip to a 4-byte representation. If ip is not an IPv4 address, To4 returns nil.

functions.name: UnmarshalText
functions.desc: UnmarshalText implements the [encoding.TextUnmarshaler] interface. The IP address is expected in a form accepted by [ParseIP].

functions.name: appendTo
functions.desc: appendTo appends the string representation of ip to b and returns the expanded b If len(ip) != IPv4len or IPv6len, it appends nothing.

functions.name: Network
functions.desc: Network returns the address's network name, "ip".

functions.name: Close
functions.desc: Close closes the connection.

functions.name: File
functions.desc: File returns a copy of the underlying [os.File]. It is the caller's responsibility to close f when finished. Closing c does not affect f, and closing f does not affect c.  The returned os.File's file descriptor is different from the connection's. Attempting to change properties of the original using this duplicate may or may not have the desired effect.  On Windows, the returned os.File's file descriptor is not usable on other processes.

functions.name: LocalAddr
functions.desc: LocalAddr returns the local network address. The Addr returned is shared by all invocations of LocalAddr, so do not modify it.

functions.name: Read
functions.desc: Read implements the Conn Read method.

functions.name: ReadFrom
functions.desc: ReadFrom implements the [PacketConn] ReadFrom method.

functions.name: ReadFromIP
functions.desc: ReadFromIP acts like ReadFrom but returns an IPAddr.

functions.name: ReadMsgIP
functions.desc: ReadMsgIP reads a message from c, copying the payload into b and the associated out-of-band data into oob. It returns the number of bytes copied into b, the number of bytes copied into oob, the flags that were set on the message and the source address of the message.  The packages golang.org/x/net/ipv4 and golang.org/x/net/ipv6 can be used to manipulate IP-level socket options in oob.

functions.name: RemoteAddr
functions.desc: RemoteAddr returns the remote network address. The Addr returned is shared by all invocations of RemoteAddr, so do not modify it.

functions.name: SetDeadline
functions.desc: SetDeadline implements the Conn SetDeadline method.

functions.name: SetReadBuffer
functions.desc: SetReadBuffer sets the size of the operating system's receive buffer associated with the connection.

functions.name: SetReadDeadline
functions.desc: SetReadDeadline implements the Conn SetReadDeadline method.

functions.name: SetWriteBuffer
functions.desc: SetWriteBuffer sets the size of the operating system's transmit buffer associated with the connection.

functions.name: SetWriteDeadline
functions.desc: SetWriteDeadline implements the Conn SetWriteDeadline method.

functions.name: SyscallConn
functions.desc: SyscallConn returns a raw network connection. This implements the [syscall.Conn] interface.

functions.name: Write
functions.desc: Write implements the Conn Write method.

functions.name: WriteMsgIP
functions.desc: WriteMsgIP writes a message to addr via c, copying the payload from b and the associated out-of-band data from oob. It returns the number of payload and out-of-band bytes written.  The packages golang.org/x/net/ipv4 and golang.org/x/net/ipv6 can be used to manipulate IP-level socket options in oob.

functions.name: WriteTo
functions.desc: WriteTo implements the [PacketConn] WriteTo method.

functions.name: WriteToIP
functions.desc: WriteToIP acts like [IPConn.WriteTo] but takes an [IPAddr].

functions.name: Size
functions.desc: Size returns the number of leading ones and total bits in the mask. If the mask is not in the canonical form--ones followed by zeros--then Size returns 0, 0.

functions.name: String
functions.desc: String returns the hexadecimal form of m, with no punctuation.

functions.name: Contains
functions.desc: Contains reports whether the network includes ip.

functions.name: Network
functions.desc: Network returns the address's network name, "ip+net".

functions.name: String
functions.desc: String returns the CIDR notation of n like "192.0.2.0/24" or "2001:db8::/48" as defined in RFC 4632 and RFC 4291. If the mask is not in the canonical form, it returns the string which consists of an IP address, followed by a slash character and a mask expressed as hexadecimal form with no punctuation like "198.51.100.0/c000ff00".

functions.name: Addrs
functions.desc: Addrs returns a list of unicast interface addresses for a specific interface.

functions.name: MulticastAddrs
functions.desc: MulticastAddrs returns a list of multicast, joined group addresses for a specific interface.

functions.name: Listen
functions.desc: Listen announces on the local network address.  See func Listen for a description of the network and address parameters.  The ctx argument is used while resolving the address on which to listen; it does not affect the returned Listener.

functions.name: ListenPacket
functions.desc: ListenPacket announces on the local network address.  See func ListenPacket for a description of the network and address parameters.  The ctx argument is used while resolving the address on which to listen; it does not affect the returned PacketConn.

functions.name: MultipathTCP
functions.desc: MultipathTCP reports whether MPTCP will be used.  This method doesn't check if MPTCP is supported by the operating system or not.

functions.name: SetMultipathTCP
functions.desc: SetMultipathTCP directs the [Listen] method to use, or not use, MPTCP, if supported by the operating system. This method overrides the system default and the GODEBUG=multipathtcp=... setting if any.  If MPTCP is not available on the host or not supported by the client, the Listen method will fall back to TCP.

functions.name: LookupAddr
functions.desc: LookupAddr performs a reverse lookup for the given address, returning a list of names mapping to that address.  The returned names are validated to be properly formatted presentation-format domain names. If the response contains invalid names, those records are filtered out and an error will be returned alongside the remaining results, if any.

functions.name: LookupCNAME
functions.desc: LookupCNAME returns the canonical name for the given host. Callers that do not care about the canonical name can call [LookupHost] or [LookupIP] directly; both take care of resolving the canonical name as part of the lookup.  A canonical name is the final name after following zero or more CNAME records. LookupCNAME does not return an error if host does not contain DNS "CNAME" records, as long as host resolves to address records.  The returned canonical name is validated to be a properly formatted presentation-format domain name.

functions.name: LookupHost
functions.desc: LookupHost looks up the given host using the local resolver. It returns a slice of that host's addresses.

functions.name: LookupIP
functions.desc: LookupIP looks up host for the given network using the local resolver. It returns a slice of that host's IP addresses of the type specified by network. network must be one of "ip", "ip4" or "ip6".

functions.name: LookupIPAddr
functions.desc: LookupIPAddr looks up host using the local resolver. It returns a slice of that host's IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

functions.name: LookupMX
functions.desc: LookupMX returns the DNS MX records for the given domain name sorted by preference.  The returned mail server names are validated to be properly formatted presentation-format domain names, or numeric IP addresses. If the response contains invalid names, those records are filtered out and an error will be returned alongside the remaining results, if any.

functions.name: LookupNS
functions.desc: LookupNS returns the DNS NS records for the given domain name.  The returned name server names are validated to be properly formatted presentation-format domain names. If the response contains invalid names, those records are filtered out and an error will be returned alongside the remaining results, if any.

functions.name: LookupNetIP
functions.desc: LookupNetIP looks up host using the local resolver. It returns a slice of that host's IP addresses of the type specified by network. The network must be one of "ip", "ip4" or "ip6".

functions.name: LookupPort
functions.desc: LookupPort looks up the port for the given network and service.  The network must be one of "tcp", "tcp4", "tcp6", "udp", "udp4", "udp6" or "ip".

functions.name: LookupSRV
functions.desc: LookupSRV tries to resolve an [SRV] query of the given service, protocol, and domain name. The proto is "tcp" or "udp". The returned records are sorted by priority and randomized by weight within a priority.  LookupSRV constructs the DNS name to look up following RFC 2782. That is, it looks up _service._proto.name. To accommodate services publishing SRV records under non-standard names, if both service and proto are empty strings, LookupSRV looks up name directly.  The returned service names are validated to be properly formatted presentation-format domain names. If the response contains invalid names, those records are filtered out and an error will be returned alongside the remaining results, if any.

functions.name: LookupTXT
functions.desc: LookupTXT returns the DNS TXT records for the given domain name.  If a DNS TXT record holds multiple strings, they are concatenated as a single string.

functions.name: dial
functions.desc: dial makes a new connection to the provided server (which must be an IP address) with the provided network type, using either r.Dial (if both r and r.Dial are non-nil) or else Dialer.DialContext.

functions.name: exchange
functions.desc: exchange sends a query on the connection and hopes for a response.

functions.name: goLookupCNAME
functions.desc: goLookupCNAME is the native Go (non-cgo) implementation of LookupCNAME.

functions.name: goLookupIP
functions.desc: goLookupIP is the native Go implementation of LookupIP. The libc versions are in cgo_*.go.

functions.name: goLookupMX
functions.desc: goLookupMX returns the MX records for name.

functions.name: goLookupNS
functions.desc: goLookupNS returns the NS records for name.

functions.name: goLookupPTR
functions.desc: goLookupPTR is the native Go implementation of LookupAddr.

functions.name: goLookupSRV
functions.desc: goLookupSRV returns the SRV records for a target name, built either from its component service ("sip"), protocol ("tcp"), and name ("example.com."), or from name directly (if service and proto are both empty).  In either case, the returned target name ("_sip._tcp.example.com.") is also returned on success.  The records are sorted by weight.

functions.name: goLookupTXT
functions.desc: goLookupTXT returns the TXT records from name.

functions.name: internetAddrList
functions.desc: internetAddrList resolves addr, which may be a literal IP address or a DNS name, and returns a list of internet protocol family addresses. The result contains at least one address when error is nil.

functions.name: lookupIPAddr
functions.desc: lookupIPAddr looks up host using the local resolver and particular network. It returns a slice of that host's IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

functions.name: resolveAddrList
functions.desc: resolveAddrList resolves addr using hint and returns a list of addresses. The result contains at least one address when error is nil.

functions.name: tryOneName
functions.desc: Do a lookup for a single name, which must be rooted (otherwise answer will not find the answers).

functions.name: SetTTL
functions.desc: SetTTL sets the TTL for subsequent written resources. Once a resource has been written, SetTTL calls are no-ops. That is, it can only be called at most once, before anything else is written.

functions.name: AddSRV
functions.desc: AddSRV adds a SRV record. The target name must end in a period and be 63 bytes or fewer.

functions.name: AddrPort
functions.desc: AddrPort returns the [TCPAddr] a as a [netip.AddrPort].  If a.Port does not fit in a uint16, it's silently truncated.  If a is nil, a zero value is returned.

functions.name: Network
functions.desc: Network returns the address's network name, "tcp".

functions.name: Close
functions.desc: Close closes the connection.

functions.name: CloseRead
functions.desc: CloseRead shuts down the reading side of the TCP connection. Most callers should just use Close.

functions.name: CloseWrite
functions.desc: CloseWrite shuts down the writing side of the TCP connection. Most callers should just use Close.

functions.name: File
functions.desc: File returns a copy of the underlying [os.File]. It is the caller's responsibility to close f when finished. Closing c does not affect f, and closing f does not affect c.  The returned os.File's file descriptor is different from the connection's. Attempting to change properties of the original using this duplicate may or may not have the desired effect.  On Windows, the returned os.File's file descriptor is not usable on other processes.

functions.name: LocalAddr
functions.desc: LocalAddr returns the local network address. The Addr returned is shared by all invocations of LocalAddr, so do not modify it.

functions.name: MultipathTCP
functions.desc: MultipathTCP reports whether the ongoing connection is using MPTCP.  If Multipath TCP is not supported by the host, by the other peer or intentionally / accidentally filtered out by a device in between, a fallback to TCP will be done. This method does its best to check if MPTCP is still being used or not.  On Linux, more conditions are verified on kernels >= v5.16, improving the results.

functions.name: Read
functions.desc: Read implements the Conn Read method.

functions.name: ReadFrom
functions.desc: ReadFrom implements the [io.ReaderFrom] ReadFrom method.

functions.name: RemoteAddr
functions.desc: RemoteAddr returns the remote network address. The Addr returned is shared by all invocations of RemoteAddr, so do not modify it.

functions.name: SetDeadline
functions.desc: SetDeadline implements the Conn SetDeadline method.

functions.name: SetKeepAlive
functions.desc: SetKeepAlive sets whether the operating system should send keep-alive messages on the connection.

functions.name: SetKeepAliveConfig
functions.desc: SetKeepAliveConfig configures keep-alive messages sent by the operating system.

functions.name: SetKeepAlivePeriod
functions.desc: SetKeepAlivePeriod sets the duration the connection needs to remain idle before TCP starts sending keepalive probes.  Note that calling this method on Windows prior to Windows 10 version 1709 will reset the KeepAliveInterval to the default system value, which is normally 1 second.

functions.name: SetLinger
functions.desc: SetLinger sets the behavior of Close on a connection which still has data waiting to be sent or to be acknowledged.  If sec < 0 (the default), the operating system finishes sending the data in the background.  If sec == 0, the operating system discards any unsent or unacknowledged data.  If sec > 0, the data is sent in the background as with sec < 0. On some operating systems including Linux, this may cause Close to block until all data has been sent or discarded. On some operating systems after sec seconds have elapsed any remaining unsent data may be discarded.

functions.name: SetNoDelay
functions.desc: SetNoDelay controls whether the operating system should delay packet transmission in hopes of sending fewer packets (Nagle's algorithm).  The default is true (no delay), meaning that data is sent as soon as possible after a Write.

functions.name: SetReadBuffer
functions.desc: SetReadBuffer sets the size of the operating system's receive buffer associated with the connection.

functions.name: SetReadDeadline
functions.desc: SetReadDeadline implements the Conn SetReadDeadline method.

functions.name: SetWriteBuffer
functions.desc: SetWriteBuffer sets the size of the operating system's transmit buffer associated with the connection.

functions.name: SetWriteDeadline
functions.desc: SetWriteDeadline implements the Conn SetWriteDeadline method.

functions.desc: SyscallConn returns a raw network connection. This implements the [syscall.Conn] interface.

functions.desc: Write implements the Conn Write method.

functions.name: WriteTo
functions.desc: WriteTo implements the io.WriterTo WriteTo method.

functions.name: Accept
functions.desc: Accept implements the Accept method in the [Listener] interface; it waits for the next call and returns a generic [Conn].

functions.name: AcceptTCP
functions.desc: AcceptTCP accepts the next incoming call and returns the new connection.

functions.name: Addr
functions.desc: Addr returns the listener's network address, a [*TCPAddr]. The Addr returned is shared by all invocations of Addr, so do not modify it.

functions.desc: Close stops listening on the TCP address. Already Accepted connections are not closed.

functions.desc: File returns a copy of the underlying [os.File]. It is the caller's responsibility to close f when finished. Closing l does not affect f, and closing f does not affect l.  The returned os.File's file descriptor is different from the connection's. Attempting to change properties of the original using this duplicate may or may not have the desired effect.  On Windows, the returned os.File's file descriptor is not usable on other processes.

functions.name: ReadMsgUDP
functions.desc: ReadMsgUDP reads a message from c, copying the payload into b and the associated out-of-band data into oob. It returns the number of bytes copied into b, the number of bytes copied into oob, the flags that were set on the message and the source address of the message.  The packages [golang.org/x/net/ipv4] and [golang.org/x/net/ipv6] can be used to manipulate IP-level socket options in oob.

functions.desc: ReadMsgUDPAddrPort is like [UDPConn.ReadMsgUDP] but returns an [netip.AddrPort] instead of a [UDPAddr].

functions.desc: WriteMsgUDP writes a message to addr via c if c isn't connected, or to c's remote address if c is connected (in which case addr must be nil). The payload is copied from b and the associated out-of-band data is copied from oob. It returns the number of payload and out-of-band bytes written.  The packages [golang.org/x/net/ipv4] and [golang.org/x/net/ipv6] can be used to manipulate IP-level socket options in oob.

functions.name: WriteMsgUDPAddrPort

functions.name: SetUnlinkOnClose
functions.desc: SetUnlinkOnClose sets whether the underlying socket file should be removed from the file system when the listener is closed.  The default behavior is to unlink the socket file only when package net created it. That is, when the listener and the underlying socket file were created by a call to Listen or ListenUnix, then by default closing the listener will remove the socket file. but if the listener was created by a call to FileListener to use an already existing socket file, then by default closing the listener will not remove the socket file.

functions.name: SyscallConn
functions.desc: SyscallConn returns a raw network connection. This implements the [syscall.Conn] interface.  The returned [syscall.RawConn] only supports calling Control. Read and Write return an error.

functions.name: first
functions.desc: first returns the first address which satisfies strategy, or if none do, then the first address of any kind.

functions.name: forResolve
functions.desc: forResolve returns the most appropriate address in address for a call to ResolveTCPAddr, ResolveUDPAddr, or ResolveIPAddr. IPv4 is preferred, unless addr contains an IPv6 literal.

functions.name: partition
functions.desc: partition divides an address list into two categories, using a strategy function to assign a boolean label to each address. The first address, and any with a matching label, are returned as primaries, while addresses with the opposite label are returned as fallbacks. For non-empty inputs, primaries is guaranteed to be non-empty.

functions.desc: addrLookupOrder determines which strategy to use to resolve addresses. The provided Resolver is optional. nil means to not consider its options. It also returns dnsConfig when it was used to determine the lookup order.

functions.name: hostLookupOrder
functions.desc: hostLookupOrder determines which strategy to use to resolve hostname. The provided Resolver is optional. nil means to not consider its options. It also returns dnsConfig when it was used to determine the lookup order.

functions.desc: mustUseGoResolver reports whether a DNS lookup of any sort is required to use the go resolver. The provided Resolver is optional. This will report true if the cgo resolver is not available.

functions.name: File
functions.desc: File returns a copy of the underlying [os.File]. It is the caller's responsibility to close f when finished. Closing c does not affect f, and closing f does not affect c.  The returned os.File's file descriptor is different from the connection's. Attempting to change properties of the original using this duplicate may or may not have the desired effect.  On Windows, the returned os.File's file descriptor is not usable on other processes.

functions.name: LocalAddr
functions.desc: LocalAddr returns the local network address. The Addr returned is shared by all invocations of LocalAddr, so do not modify it.

functions.name: Read
functions.desc: Read implements the Conn Read method.

functions.name: RemoteAddr
functions.desc: RemoteAddr returns the remote network address. The Addr returned is shared by all invocations of RemoteAddr, so do not modify it.

functions.name: SetDeadline
functions.desc: SetDeadline implements the Conn SetDeadline method.

functions.name: SetReadBuffer
functions.desc: SetReadBuffer sets the size of the operating system's receive buffer associated with the connection.

functions.name: SetReadDeadline
functions.desc: SetReadDeadline implements the Conn SetReadDeadline method.

functions.name: SetWriteBuffer
functions.desc: SetWriteBuffer sets the size of the operating system's transmit buffer associated with the connection.

functions.name: SetWriteDeadline
functions.desc: SetWriteDeadline implements the Conn SetWriteDeadline method.

functions.name: Write
functions.desc: Write implements the Conn Write method.

types.name: Addr
types.desc: Addr represents a network end point address.  The two methods [Addr.Network] and [Addr.String] conventionally return strings that can be passed as the arguments to [Dial], but the exact form and meaning of the strings is up to the implementation.

types.name: Buffers
types.desc: Buffers contains zero or more runs of bytes to write.  On certain machines, for certain types of connections, this is optimized into an OS-specific batch write operation (such as "writev").

types.name: Conn
types.desc: Conn is a generic stream-oriented network connection.  Multiple goroutines may invoke methods on a Conn simultaneously.

types.name: DNSConfigError
types.desc: DNSConfigError represents an error reading the machine's DNS configuration. (No longer used; kept for compatibility.)

types.name: DNSError
types.desc: DNSError represents a DNS lookup error.

types.name: Dialer
types.desc: A Dialer contains options for connecting to an address.  The zero value for each field is equivalent to dialing without that option. Dialing with the zero value of Dialer is therefore equivalent to just calling the [Dial] function.  It is safe to call Dialer's methods concurrently.

types.name: Error
types.desc: An Error represents a network error.

types.name: HardwareAddr
types.desc: A HardwareAddr represents a physical hardware address.

types.name: IP
types.desc: An IP is a single IP address, a slice of bytes. Functions in this package accept either 4-byte (IPv4) or 16-byte (IPv6) slices as input.  Note that in this documentation, referring to an IP address as an IPv4 address or an IPv6 address is a semantic property of the address, not just the length of the byte slice: a 16-byte slice can still be an IPv4 address.

types.name: IPAddr
types.desc: IPAddr represents the address of an IP end point.

types.name: IPConn
types.desc: IPConn is the implementation of the [Conn] and [PacketConn] interfaces for IP network connections.

types.name: IPMask
types.desc: An IPMask is a bitmask that can be used to manipulate IP addresses for IP addressing and routing.  See type [IPNet] and func [ParseCIDR] for details.

types.name: IPNet
types.desc: An IPNet represents an IP network.

types.name: Interface
types.desc: Interface represents a mapping between network interface name and index. It also represents network interface facility information.

types.name: KeepAliveConfig
types.desc: KeepAliveConfig contains TCP keep-alive options.  If the Idle, Interval, or Count fields are zero, a default value is chosen. If a field is negative, the corresponding socket-level option will be left unchanged.  Note that prior to Windows 10 version 1709, neither setting Idle and Interval separately nor changing Count (which is usually 10) is supported. Therefore, it's recommended to set both Idle and Interval to non-negative values in conjunction with a -1 for Count on those old Windows if you intend to customize the TCP keep-alive settings. By contrast, if only one of Idle and Interval is set to a non-negative value, the other will be set to the system default value, and ultimately, set both Idle and Interval to negative values if you want to leave them unchanged.  Note that Solaris and its derivatives do not support setting Interval to a non-negative value and Count to a negative value, or vice-versa.

types.name: ListenConfig
types.desc: ListenConfig contains options for listening to an address.

types.name: Listener
types.desc: A Listener is a generic network listener for stream-oriented protocols.  Multiple goroutines may invoke methods on a Listener simultaneously.

types.name: MX
types.desc: An MX represents a single DNS MX record.

types.name: NS
types.desc: An NS represents a single DNS NS record.

types.name: OpError
types.desc: OpError is the error type usually returned by functions in the net package. It describes the operation, network type, and address of an error.

types.name: PacketConn
types.desc: PacketConn is a generic packet-oriented network connection.  Multiple goroutines may invoke methods on a PacketConn simultaneously.

types.name: ParseError
types.desc: A ParseError is the error type of literal network address parsers.

types.name: Resolver
types.desc: A Resolver looks up names and numbers.  A nil *Resolver is equivalent to a zero Resolver.

types.name: SRV
types.desc: An SRV represents a single DNS SRV record.

types.name: TCPAddr
types.desc: TCPAddr represents the address of a TCP end point.

types.name: TCPConn
types.desc: TCPConn is an implementation of the [Conn] interface for TCP network connections.

types.name: TCPListener
types.desc: TCPListener is a TCP network listener. Clients should typically use variables of type [Listener] instead of assuming TCP.

types.name: UDPAddr
types.desc: UDPAddr represents the address of a UDP end point.

types.name: UDPConn
types.desc: UDPConn is the implementation of the [Conn] and [PacketConn] interfaces for UDP network connections.

types.name: UnixAddr
types.desc: UnixAddr represents the address of a Unix domain socket end point.

types.name: UnixConn
types.desc: UnixConn is an implementation of the [Conn] interface for connections to Unix domain sockets.

types.name: UnixListener
types.desc: UnixListener is a Unix domain socket listener. Clients should typically use variables of type [Listener] instead of assuming Unix domain sockets.

types.name: addrList
types.desc: An addrList represents a list of network endpoint addresses.

types.name: addrPortUDPAddr
types.desc: An addrPortUDPAddr is a netip.AddrPort-based UDP address that satisfies the Addr interface.

types.name: addrinfoErrno
types.desc: An addrinfoErrno represents a getaddrinfo, getnameinfo-specific error number. It's a signed number and a zero value is a non-error by convention.

types.name: buffersWriter
types.desc: buffersWriter is the interface implemented by Conns that support a "writev"-like batch write optimization. writeBuffers should fully consume and write all chunks from the provided Buffers, else it should report a non-nil error.

types.name: byPref
types.desc: byPref sorts MX records by preference

types.name: byPriorityWeight
types.desc: byPriorityWeight sorts SRV records by ascending priority and weight.

types.name: canceledError
types.desc: canceledError lets us return the same error string we have always returned, while still being Is context.Canceled.

types.name: conf
types.desc: conf is used to determine name resolution configuration.

types.name: hostLookupOrder
types.desc: hostLookupOrder specifies the order of LookupHost lookup strategies. It is basically a simplified representation of nsswitch.conf. "files" means /etc/hosts.

types.name: ipv6ZoneCache
types.desc: An ipv6ZoneCache represents a cache holding partial network interface information. It is used for reducing the cost of IPv6 addressing scope zone resolution.  Multiple names sharing the index are managed by first-come first-served basis for consistency.

types.name: mdnsTest
types.desc: mdnsTest is for testing only.

types.name: mptcpStatusDial
types.desc: mptcpStatusDial is a tristate for Multipath TCP on clients, see go.dev/issue/56539

types.name: mptcpStatusListen
types.desc: mptcpStatusListen is a tristate for Multipath TCP on servers, see go.dev/issue/56539

types.name: netFD
types.desc: Network file descriptor.

types.name: noReadFrom
types.desc: noReadFrom can be embedded alongside another type to hide the ReadFrom method of that other type.

types.name: noWriteTo
types.desc: noWriteTo can be embedded alongside another type to hide the WriteTo method of that other type.

types.name: notFoundError
types.desc: notFoundError is a special error understood by the newDNSError function, which causes a creation of a DNSError with IsNotFound field set to true.

types.name: nssConf
types.desc: nssConf represents the state of the machine's /etc/nsswitch.conf file.

types.name: nssCriterion
types.desc: nssCriterion is the parsed structure of one of the criteria in brackets after an NSS source name.

types.name: onlyValuesCtx
types.desc: onlyValuesCtx is a context that uses an underlying context for value lookup if the underlying context hasn't yet expired.

types.name: packetQueue
types.desc: A packetQueue is a set of 1-buffered channels implementing a FIFO queue of packets.

types.name: pipeDeadline
types.desc: pipeDeadline is an abstraction for handling timeouts.

types.name: resolverConfig
types.desc: A resolverConfig represents a DNS stub resolver configuration.

types.name: scope
types.desc: RFC 6724 section 3.1.

types.name: sockaddr
types.desc: A sockaddr represents a TCP, UDP, IP or Unix network endpoint address that can be converted into a syscall.Sockaddr.

types.name: sysDialer
types.desc: sysDialer contains a Dial's parameters and configuration.

types.name: sysListener
types.desc: sysListener contains a Listen's parameters and configuration.

types.name: tcpConnWithoutReadFrom
types.desc: tcpConnWithoutReadFrom implements all the methods of *TCPConn other than ReadFrom. This is used to permit ReadFrom to call io.Copy without leading to a recursive call to ReadFrom.

types.name: tcpConnWithoutWriteTo
types.desc: tcpConnWithoutWriteTo implements all the methods of *TCPConn other than WriteTo. This is used to permit WriteTo to call io.Copy without leading to a recursive call to WriteTo.

types.name: temporaryError
types.desc: temporaryError is an error type that implements the [Error] interface. It returns true from the Temporary method.

functions.name: BenchmarkClient
functions.desc: A benchmark for profiling the client without the HTTP server code. The server code runs in a subprocess.

functions.name: BenchmarkServer
functions.desc: A benchmark for profiling the server without the HTTP client code. The client code runs in a subprocess.  For use like:  	$ go test -c 	$ ./http.test -test.run='^$' -test.bench='^BenchmarkServer$' -test.benchtime=15s -test.cpuprofile=http.prof 	$ go tool pprof http.test http.prof 	(pprof) web

functions.name: BenchmarkServerFakeConnWithKeepAliveLite
functions.desc: same as above, but representing the most simple possible request and handler. Notably: the handler does not call rw.Header().

functions.name: BenchmarkServerHandlerNoHeader
functions.desc: Neither a Content-Type or Content-Length, so sniffed and counted.

functions.name: BenchmarkServerHandlerNoLen
functions.desc: A Content-Type is set, but no length. No sniffing, but will count the Content-Length.

functions.name: BenchmarkServerHandlerNoType
functions.desc: A Content-Length is set, but the Content-Type will be sniffed.

functions.name: BenchmarkServerHandlerTypeLen
functions.desc: Both Content-Type and Content-Length set. Should be no buffering.

functions.name: ExampleResponseWriter_trailers
functions.desc: HTTP Trailers are a set of key/value pairs like headers that come after the HTTP response, instead of before.

functions.name: Test304Responses

functions.name: TestAltProtoCancellation

functions.name: TestAutomaticHTTP2_Serve_NoTLSConfig
functions.desc: Issue 15908

functions.name: TestCancelRequestMidBody

functions.name: TestCancelRequestWhenSharingConnection

functions.name: TestChunkedNoContent

functions.name: TestClientCallsCloseOnlyOnce

functions.name: TestClientCanClose

functions.name: TestClientCopyHeadersOnRedirect

functions.name: TestClientCopyHostOnRedirect

functions.name: TestClientHeadContentLength

functions.name: TestClientRedirect308NoGetBody

functions.name: TestClientRedirectNoLocation

functions.name: TestClientRedirectResponseWithoutRequest

functions.name: TestClientRedirectsContext
functions.desc: Tests that Client redirects' contexts are derived from the original request's context.

functions.name: TestClientStripHeadersOnRepeatedRedirect
functions.desc: Issue #70530: Once we strip a header on a redirect to a different host, the header should stay stripped across any further redirects.

functions.name: TestClientTimeoutCancel

functions.name: TestClientTimeoutDoesNotExpire

functions.desc: Issue 23399: verify that if a client request times out, the Transport's conn is closed so that it's not reused.  This is the test variant that has the server send response headers first, and time out during the write of the response body.

functions.name: TestClientTimeoutKillsConn_BeforeHeaders
functions.desc: Issue 23399: verify that if a client request times out, the Transport's conn is closed so that it's not reused.  This is the test variant that times out before the server replies with any response headers.

functions.name: TestClientTimeout_Headers
functions.desc: Client.Timeout firing before getting to the body

functions.name: TestClientWriteShutdown
functions.desc: TestClientWriteShutdown tests that if the client shuts down the write side of their TCP connection, the server doesn't send a 400 Bad Request.

functions.name: TestClientWrites
functions.desc: TestClientWrites verifies that client requests are buffered and we don't send a TCP packet per line of the http request + body.

functions.name: TestCloseIdleConnections
functions.desc: Issue 14607

functions.name: TestCloseNotifierPipelined
functions.desc: Tests that a pipelined request does not cause the first request's Handler's CloseNotify channel to fire.  Issue 13165 (where it used to deadlock), but behavior changed in Issue 23921.

functions.name: TestCodesPreventingContentTypeAndBody
functions.desc: Issue 6157, Issue 6685

functions.name: TestConcurrentServerServe
functions.desc: Verify this doesn't race (Issue 16505)

functions.name: TestConnClosedBeforeRequestIsWritten
functions.desc: https://go.dev/issue/49621

functions.name: TestConnContextNotModifyingAllContexts
functions.desc: Issue 35750: check ConnContext not modifying context for other connections

functions.name: TestContentEncodingNoSniffing
functions.desc: Issue 31753: don't sniff when Content-Encoding is set

functions.name: TestContentLengthZero
functions.desc: TestContentLengthZero tests that for both an HTTP/1.0 and HTTP/1.1 request (both keep-alive), when a Handler never writes any response, the net/http package adds a "Content-Length: 0" response header.

functions.name: TestDisableContentLength
functions.desc: TestDisableContentLength verifies that the Content-Length is set by default or disabled when the header is set to nil.

functions.name: TestDontCacheBrokenHTTP2Conn
functions.desc: Issue 34978: don't cache a broken HTTP/2 connection

functions.name: TestErrorWriteLoopRace
functions.desc: Issue 37669 Test that a cancellation doesn't result in a data race due to the writeLoop goroutine being left running, if the caller mutates the processed Request upon completion.

functions.name: TestFileServerDirWithRootFile
functions.desc: Issue 63769

functions.name: TestFileServerNotDirError
functions.desc: Issues 18984, 49552: tests that requests for paths beyond files return not-found errors

functions.name: TestFormFileCallsParseMultipartForm

functions.name: TestFormValueCallsParseMultipartForm
functions.desc: Test that FormValue invokes ParseMultipartForm.

functions.name: TestH12_AutoGzip
functions.desc: Verify that both our HTTP/1 and HTTP/2 request and auto-decompress gzip. Some hosts send gzip even if you don't ask for it; see golang.org/issue/13298

functions.name: TestH12_AutoGzipWithDumpResponse
functions.desc: Issue 15366

functions.name: TestH12_HeadContentLengthNoBody
functions.desc: Issue 13532

functions.name: TestH12_WebSocketUpgrade
functions.desc: Always use HTTP/1.1 for WebSocket upgrades.

functions.name: TestHTTP10ConnectionHeader
functions.desc: https://golang.org/issue/5955 Note that this does not test the "request too large" exit path from the http server. This is intentional; not sending Connection: close is just a minor wire optimization and is pointless if dealing with a badly behaved client.

functions.name: TestHTTP10KeepAlive204Response
functions.desc: Issue 15647: 204 responses can't have bodies, so HTTP/1.0 keep-alive conns should stay open.

functions.name: TestHTTPSClientDetectsHTTPServer
functions.desc: Check that an HTTPS client can interpret a particular TLS error to determine that the server is speaking HTTP. See golang.org/issue/11111.

functions.name: TestHandlerFinishSkipBigContentLengthRead
functions.desc: If a Handler finishes and there's an unread request body, verify the server implicitly tries to do a read on it before replying.

functions.name: TestHandlerSetTransferEncodingChunked
functions.desc: https://golang.org/issue/15960

functions.name: TestHandlerSetTransferEncodingGzip
functions.desc: https://golang.org/issue/16063

functions.name: TestHandlerWritesTooMuch
functions.desc: Tests that the HTTP/1 and HTTP/2 servers prevent handlers from writing more than they declared. This test does not test whether the transport deals with too much data, though, since the server doesn't make it possible to send bogus data. For those tests, see transport_test.go (for HTTP/1) or x/net/http2/transport_test.go (for HTTP/2).

functions.name: TestHandlersCanSetConnectionClose11
functions.desc: TestHandlersCanSetConnectionClose verifies that handlers can force a connection to close, even for HTTP/1.1 requests.

functions.name: TestHeadReaderFrom
functions.desc: Ensure ResponseWriter.ReadFrom doesn't write a body in response to a HEAD request. https://go.dev/issue/68609

functions.name: TestHeadResponses
functions.desc: TestHeadResponses verifies that all MIME type sniffing and Content-Length counting of GET requests also happens on HEAD requests.

functions.name: TestHeaderToWire
functions.desc: Tests regarding the ordering of Write, WriteHeader, Header, and Flush calls. In Go 1.0, rw.WriteHeader immediately flushed the (*response).header to the wire. In Go 1.1, the actual wire flush is delayed, so we could maybe tack on a Content-Length and better Content-Type after we see more (or all) of the output. To preserve compatibility with Go 1, we need to be careful to track which headers were live at the time of WriteHeader, so we write the same ones, even if the handler modifies them (~erroneously) after the first Write.

functions.name: TestHijackAfterCloseNotifier
functions.desc: Tests that we can use CloseNotifier in one request, and later call Hijack on a second request on the same connection.  It also tests that the connReader stitches together its background 1-byte read for CloseNotifier when CloseNotifier doesn't fire with the rest of the second HTTP later.  Issue 9763. HTTP/1-only test. (http2 doesn't have Hijack)

functions.name: TestIdentityResponse
functions.desc: TestIdentityResponse verifies that a handler can unset

functions.name: TestIdleConnH2Crash
functions.desc: Issue 16208: Go 1.7 crashed after Transport.IdleConnTimeout if an HTTP/2 connection was established but its caller no longer wanted it. (Assuming the connection cache was enabled, which it is by default)  This test reproduced the crash by setting the IdleConnTimeout low (to make the test reasonable) and then making a request which is canceled by the DialTLS hook, which then also waits to return the real connection until after the RoundTrip saw the error.  Then we know the successful tls.Dial from DialTLS will need to go into the idle pool. Then we give it a of time to explode.

functions.name: TestIssue32441
functions.desc: Issue 32441: body is not reset after ErrSkipAltProtocol

functions.name: TestIssue3595
functions.desc: Test that a client receives a server's reply, even if the server doesn't read the entire request body.

functions.desc: Test that the transport doesn't close the TCP connection early, before the response body has been read. This was a regression which sadly lacked a triggering test. The large response body made the old race easier to trigger.

functions.name: TestKeepAliveFinalChunkWithEOF
functions.desc: Issue 15703

functions.name: TestMaxBytesReaderStickyError

functions.name: TestMuxNoSlashRedirectWithTrailingSlash
functions.desc: Test that we don't attempt trailing-slash redirect on a path that already has a trailing slash. See issue #65624.

functions.name: TestMuxRedirectLeadingSlashes
functions.desc: Tests for https://golang.org/issue/900

functions.name: TestNewClientServerTest
functions.desc: Testing the newClientServerTest helper itself.

functions.name: TestNewRequestGetBody
functions.desc: verify that NewRequest sets Request.GetBody and that it works

functions.name: TestNoBodyOnChunked304Response
functions.desc: Issue 22330: do not allow the response body to be read when the status code forbids a response body.

functions.name: TestNoContentLengthIfTransferEncoding

functions.name: TestNoCrashReturningTransportAltConn

functions.name: TestNoWriteDeadline

functions.name: TestOnlyWriteTimeout
functions.desc: golang.org/issue/4741 -- setting only a write timeout that triggers shouldn't cause a handler to block forever on reads (next HTTP request) that will never happen.

functions.name: TestParseFormQueryMethods
functions.desc: Tests that we only parse the form automatically for certain methods.

functions.name: TestParseFormSemicolonSeparator
functions.desc: Issue #25192: Test that ParseForm fails but still parses the form when a URL containing a semicolon is provided.

functions.name: TestParseMultipartFormFilename
functions.desc: Issue 45789: multipart form should not include directory path in filename

functions.name: TestParseMultipartFormOrder
functions.desc: Test that ParseMultipartForm errors if called after MultipartReader on the same request.

functions.name: TestParseMultipartFormPopulatesPostForm
functions.desc: Issue 9305: ParseMultipartForm should populate PostForm too

functions.name: TestParseMultipartFormSemicolonSeparator
functions.desc: Issue #25192: Test that ParseMultipartForm fails but still parses the multi-part form when a URL containing a semicolon is provided.

functions.name: TestQuerySemicolon

functions.name: TestRedirect
functions.desc: Test different URL formats and schemes

functions.name: TestRedirectContentTypeAndBody
functions.desc: Test that Redirect sets Content-Type header for GET and HEAD requests and writes a short HTML body, unless the request already has a Content-Type header.

functions.name: TestRedirectGetBody
functions.desc: Make sure the retries copies the GetBody in the request.

functions.name: TestRequestBodyCloseDoesntBlock
functions.desc: Test that a hanging Request.Body.Read from another goroutine can't cause the Handler goroutine's Request.Body.Close to block. See issue 7121.

functions.name: TestRequestClonePathValue
functions.desc: Ensure that Request.Clone works correctly with PathValue. See issue 64911.

functions.name: TestRequestCloneTransferEncoding
functions.desc: Ensure that Request.Clone creates a deep copy of TransferEncoding. See issue 41907.

functions.name: TestRequestCookie
functions.desc: Issue 53181: verify Request.Cookie return the correct Cookie. Return ErrNoCookie instead of the first cookie when name is "".

functions.name: TestResponseBodyReadAfterClose
functions.desc: Don't allow a Body.Read after Body.Close. Issue 13648.

functions.name: TestResponseWriterWriteString
functions.desc: test that ResponseWriter implements io.StringWriter.

functions.name: TestRetryRequestsOnError
functions.desc: Issues 4677, 18241, and 17844. If we try to reuse a connection that the server is in the process of closing, we may end up successfully writing out our request (or a portion of our request) only to find a connection error when we try to read from (or finish writing to) the socket.  NOTE: we resend a request only if:   - we reused a keep-alive connection   - we haven't yet received any header data   - either we wrote no bytes to the server, or the request is idempotent  This automatically prevents an infinite resend loop because we'll run out of the cached keep-alive connections eventually.

functions.name: TestRoundTripGzip
functions.desc: Test that the modification made to the Request by the RoundTripper is cleaned up

functions.name: TestRoundTripReturnsProxyError
functions.desc: Test for issue 8755 Ensure that if a proxy returns an error, it is exposed by RoundTrip

functions.name: TestServeContentWithEmptyContentIgnoreRanges
functions.desc: Tests that ranges are ignored with serving empty content. (Issue 54794)

functions.name: TestServeDirWithoutTrailingSlash
functions.desc: Issue 13996

functions.name: TestServeFileDirPanicEmptyPath
functions.desc: Tests that this doesn't panic. (Issue 30165)

functions.name: TestServeFileNotModified
functions.desc: Tests that ServeFile does not generate representation metadata when file has not been modified, as per RFC 7232 section 4.1.

functions.name: TestServeFileRejectsInvalidSuffixLengths
functions.desc: Issue 40940: Ensure that we only accept non-negative suffix-lengths in "Range": "bytes=-N", and should reject "bytes=--2".

functions.name: TestServeFileWithContentEncoding
functions.desc: Tests that ServeFile doesn't add a Content-Length if a Content-Encoding is specified.

functions.name: TestServeHTTP10Close
functions.desc: TestServeHTTP10Close verifies that HTTP/1.0 requests won't be kept alive.

functions.desc: Issue 24297

functions.name: TestServeMuxHandlerTrailingSlash
functions.desc: Issue 73688

functions.name: TestServeWithSlashRedirectKeepsQueryString
functions.desc: Test that the special cased "/route" redirect implicitly created by a registered "/route/" properly sets the query string in the redirect URL. See Issue 17841.

functions.name: TestServerAllowsBlockingRemoteAddr
functions.desc: Issue 12943

functions.name: TestServerBufferedChunking
functions.desc: Tests that chunked server responses that write 1 byte at a time are buffered before chunk headers are added, not after chunk headers.

functions.name: TestServerCancelsReadHeaderTimeoutWhenIdle
functions.desc: Issue 54784: test that the Server's ReadHeaderTimeout only starts once the beginning of a request has been received, rather than including time the connection spent idle.

functions.name: TestServerCancelsReadTimeoutWhenIdle
functions.desc: Issue 18447: test that the Server's ReadTimeout is stopped while the server's doing its 1-byte background read between requests, waiting for the connection to maybe close.

functions.name: TestServerCloseDeadlock
functions.desc: Issue 17878: tests that we can call Close twice.

functions.name: TestServerCloseListenerOnce
functions.desc: Issue 24803: don't call Listener.Close on Server.Shutdown.

functions.name: TestServerDuplicateBackgroundRead
functions.desc: Issue 18535: test that the Server doesn't try to do a background read if it's already done one.

functions.name: TestServerEmptyBodyRace
functions.desc: golang.org/issue/7856

functions.name: TestServerExpect
functions.desc: Tests that the server responds to the "Expect" request header correctly.

functions.name: TestServerFileStatError
functions.desc: Issue 12991

functions.name: TestServerFlushAndHijack
functions.desc: This verifies that a handler can Flush and then Hijack.  A similar test crashed once during development, but it was only testing this tangentially and temporarily until another TODO was fixed.  So add an explicit test for this.

functions.name: TestServerGracefulClose
functions.desc: Tests that the server flushes its response headers out when it's ignoring the response body and waits a bit before forcefully closing the TCP connection, causing the client to get a RST. See https://golang.org/issue/3595

functions.name: TestServerHijackGetsBackgroundByte
functions.desc: Test that the bufio.Reader returned by Hijack includes any buffered byte (from the Server's backgroundRead) in its buffer. We want the Handler code to be able to tell that a byte is available via bufio.Reader.Buffered(), without resorting to Reading it (potentially blocking) to get at it.

functions.name: TestServerHijackGetsBackgroundByte_big
functions.desc: Like TestServerHijackGetsBackgroundByte above but sending a immediate 1MB of data to the server to fill up the server's 4KB buffer.

functions.name: TestServerHijackGetsFullBody
functions.desc: Test that the bufio.Reader returned by Hijack yields the entire body.

functions.name: TestServerIssue5953
functions.desc: Issue 5953: shouldn't sniff if the handler set a Content-Type header, even if it's the empty string.

functions.name: TestServerKeepAliveAfterWriteError
functions.desc: golang.org/issue/8534 -- the Server shouldn't reuse a connection for keep-alive after it's seen any Write error (e.g. a timeout) on that net.Conn.  To test, verify we don't timeout or see fewer unique client addresses (== unique connections) than requests.

functions.name: TestServerKeepAlivesEnabled
functions.desc: Issue 17717: tests that Server.SetKeepAlivesEnabled is respected by both HTTP/1 and HTTP/2.

functions.name: TestServerListenNotComparableListener
